page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The shoreline of the North Sea runs diagonally across our area, the N.E. forty percent of the map being sea. At low tide fine sandy beaches reach to the foot of tall crumbling cliffs, rising to a height of seventy metres. Mundesley is a 'large' village that grew up where the river Mun follows a small gap in the cliffs to the sea. The rest of the coast goes up through farmland and caravan sites to the small village of Trimingham, which is itself slowly crumbling into the sea Most of the inland area is covered by rolling agricultural land. mainly growing barley,wheat or sugar beet. Gimingham is a picturesque farming village lying on the banks of the Mun. This is a quiet rural area now being influence by the nearby Bacton Gas Site,whose industrial workings are easily visible by day or night.
